text:
In these videos, I hope to 
teach you some basic English.
So, these videos are for low level beginners.

Now when you watch these videos,
I want you to pay attention.
Watch all the videos in the series.

Please listen carefully and if there are any
words or expressions that you don’t know,
Another thing you should do is repeat after me.
Repeating is a really good practice.
So, I know that some of these videos are hard.

If you try your best, and watch all of these
videos,
I know that your English will get better.
Hi, everybody and welcome to this video.

Now in this video, I want to talk about the
difference between consonants and vowels.

Now, in the English alphabet, 
there are twenty-six letters.

And in the alphabet, there are five main vowels
and one special vowel.
So, let’s look at the board.
The first letter, ‘a’, is a vowel.
The next letter, ‘b’, is a consonant.
And we’ll talk about that more later on.

And ‘z’ is the last letter,
and it is a consonant.

Okay, so, there are twenty-six 
letters in the alphabet.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.
Now all English words have vowels.
So, let’s look at these words.
Okay, we have ‘c’ is a consonant.

So, we have the main vowels:
‘a’, ’e’, ‘i’, ‘o’, ‘u’.
Now, I said ‘y’ is a special vowel.

That’s because sometimes it’s a vowel
and sometimes it’s a consonant.

‘i’ is the letter ‘i’, right,
it sounds like the letter ‘i’.
So, in this case ‘y’ is also a vowel.
Now, in the last two words,
“you” and “yes”, the letter ‘y’ is a consonant.
Usually, if ‘y’ comes at the beginning of a word,
or if it makes a /u/ sound,

Now to help us remember vowels, we can say,
“a, e, i, o, u and sometimes y.”
“a, e, i, o, u and sometimes y.”
“a, e, i, o, u and sometimes y.”
Okay, and that’s the end of this video. Thank you.
Hi everybody and welcome to this video.

In this video, we’re going to 
talk about using ‘a’ or ‘an’.
We use ‘a’ or ‘an’ in front of nouns.
A noun is a person, place, thing, or animal.
Okay, so let’s look at the board.
The first noun we have is “banana”.
In this case, the first letter is ‘a’.
Remember the vowels are a, e, i, o, u,
The first letter, ‘c’, is a consonant.
Remember, if it’s a consonant, we have to put ‘a’.
Again, the word starts with a consonant: ‘b’.
So, we have to say, “a boy”.
The next word, “egg”, has the letter ‘e’ in front.
If we read it, it sounds like “an egg.”
Okay, and the last word is “ant”.
So again, we must put……”an ant”.
Now, let’s go through these words together.
Keep in mind that when you have ‘an’ in front,
it has to sound like almost one word.
Again, it sounds like one word.
Okay. Let’s move on the next part.
Okay, let’s do some extra practice.
Ahhh, I have some nouns on the board.

Remember, a noun is a person, place, thing
or animal.
So let’s go through them one by one.
It’s a thing that we read.

“park”, is a place.
 
It’s a place we go.

Right. Umbrella is a thing that we use when it’s
raining.

And “orange”.
"orange" is a thing that we eat.

Okay. Now, I’m going to say ‘a’ or ‘an’
in front of the nouns.

I want you to listen and see if you can hear
the difference.

In that case we say, “a book”.
“a book”.

Remember, we put ‘a’ in front of words
that begin with consonants.
That’s why we say, “a book”, “a park”.

Could you here the difference?
“an umbrella”.

We say ‘an’ because umbrella starts with
a vowel: ‘u’.

And the last word, “an orange”.
“an orange”.

Again, we have to say, “an orange” because
‘o’ is a vowel.
So, let’s go through each word one more time.
Notice it sounds like one word.
Okay. So that’s the end of this video.
I hope you can remember when to use ‘a’ and ‘an’.
Hi, everybody and welcome to this video.

Now, in this lesson I’m going to talk about
singular and plural nouns.
And plural means more than one or many.

Okay.
So let’s look at the board.
This part is showing singular nouns.

So when the noun is singular,
we put ‘a’ or ‘an’.
So again, one…. noun is singular.

Okay.
Now over here, we have plural nouns.

Plural means more than one.
Two, three, four, and so on.
So, when we have a plural noun, we have to,
don’t forget, we have to put ‘s’ or ‘es’.
Again, if there’s more than one,
Now the nouns here, you just have to add an ‘s’.

Okay, and we’re going to 
go through them right now.

Okay, we had one ring.
“a ring”.

Now we have “two rings.”
With an ‘s’.
Okay, you must not forget that.

Okay.
I really need you to remember that.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.
Now we have some more nouns.
These nouns are a little bit different.
Uhhh, when they’re singular it’s the same.

But when you want to make them 
plural, you have to add ‘es’.

Remember, I said, you can add ‘s’ or ‘es’
to make a noun plural…more than one.
So again, these nouns you have to add ‘es’.
So let’s go through them one more time.

Okay.
Now, we’re going to move on to the plural.
Remember, again, to make the plural, or more

than one, here, we add ‘es’.
Okay.

So don’t forget.
We have to put
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.

So, how do we know if we should put ‘s’
or ‘es’ to make the noun plural?
Well, for most nouns, you just have to put ‘s’.

But, for some, you have to put ‘es’.
And how do we know?

Let’s look at the board.
We have some nouns.

So if the noun ends in ‘ch’, you have
to put ‘es’.
So again, if the noun ends in ‘ch’,
add ‘es’ at the end to make it plural.
The same goes for the next word “brush”.

So if it ends in ‘sh’, same thing, we
add ‘es’ at the end to make it plural.

We have the letter ‘x’ at the end.
Okay.

All nouns that end in ‘x’, we have to
put ‘es’ to make it plural.
If the noun ends with these, put ‘es’.
Okay, we have ‘ss’ at the end.
Put ‘es’ at the end to make it plural.
Again, if it ends in ‘ss’ put ‘es’.
we must put ‘es’ at the end.
Most of the other nouns we just add ‘s’.

Okay.
Now we have some special nouns on this side.
Now, most nouns that end in ‘o’, like “photo”,

all we have to do is add an ‘s’
to make it plural.
But these are special because we actually

have to put ‘es’ at the end… to make
them…plural.

Okay.
So we have “potatoes, tomatoes, volcanoes”.
Again, these are a little bit special.

For most nouns that end in ‘o’, we just
add ‘s’.
Okay, and, uhhh, let’s go to the final part.
Okay, let’s do some extra practice.
On the board, I have some nouns.
Some are singular and some are plural.

We have to decide together 
if we should put ‘s’ or ‘es’

So you have to listen carefully and 
remember what we learned in this video.

Right, this is plural.
There are two.

“two books”
We have to put an ‘s’.

“class” ends with an ‘s’.
So what do we put?

Okay.
So again the plural is “three classes”.

Do we have to put anything?
No.

No ‘s’ or ‘es’ because this is singular.
There’s just one lion.

We have to put an ‘s’.
“six hats”

Okay.
The next noun is “seven match”.

Well, we have a ‘ch’.
So we have to put “matches”.

Okay.
And the last one is “one bat”.

We do not put an ‘s’ or ‘es’ because
again, it’s just one.
We don’t have to put anything after ‘bat’.

Okay, so, in this video, we learned how to
make a noun singular.

Okay.
And how to make a noun plural.

Remember, singular means one.
Plural means more than one.
And remember, don’t forget, we have to put

And thanks for joining.
That’s the end of this video.
Hi everybody and welcome to this video.

In this video, we’re going to 
talk about subjective pronouns.
So, let’s take a look at the board.

Here they are.
The subjective pronouns.

Please take a careful look.
They’re very important in English.

Okay.
So, the first subjective pronoun is ‘I’.

He
Now, “he” is only used for boys or men.
So another boy or man is “he”.
“She” is used for girls or women.

is used for a place like a school,
an animal like a dog, or a thing like a chair.

The next one is “you”.
“You” means you.

We
“We” means other people and me.

For example, “I sing”, “you sing”,
then “we sing”.

“They” means many people, 
places, animals or things.

If there’s more than one, we use 
the subjective pronoun ‘they’.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.

Okay, so let’s practice together 
with subjective pronouns.

The first sentence on the 
board says, “Jenny sings”.
So we have to say, “he sings”.

The last sentence says, “Jenny and Jack
sing”.
Now Jenny and Jack are two people.
So we have to say, “they sing”.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.
Okay, let’s do some more practice.
The first sentence on the board says,

‘The cat’ is an animal, so we have to
say, “It runs”.
The next sentence says, “The dog and cat run”.
Now, ‘the dog and cat’, they are two animals.

So anytime you have two or more 
things, we say, “They run”.

Okay, now, for the last sentence, I’m 
going to talk about my cat, Ongee.

Ongee is a cat.
He’s an animal.

But he has a name.
He’s a boy cat.

Okay and I love him.
And he’s like family.

So, “Ongee runs”.
I can say “He runs”.

Okay.
Let’s move on to the next part.
Okay, here are some more examples.

But, this time, you have to figure out the
subjective pronoun together with me.
They’re people and there’s more than one.
So we have to use the subjective pronoun, ‘they’.
We have to use the subjective pronoun, ‘he’.

Okay, the last one.
“Pizza is delicious”.
Let’s move on to some more examples.
So we have to use the subjective pronoun, ‘it’.

Now, ‘Ongee’ is my cat.
“My parents love Ongee”.

Well, ‘my parents’, they are two people.
My mom and my dad.

I have to say, “they”.
“They love Ongee”.

The last example is very 
similar to the second one.

“My parents and I love Ongee”.
Okay.
The difference is… it says, “and I”.

So I have to say, “we”.
“We love Ongee”.

Okay, so, in this video we 
learned about subjective pronouns.

I hope you guys have a good understanding 
of ‘when’ and ‘how’ to use them.

Thank you for watching and I’ll see you
guys next time.

We took out the ‘a’ and we put an ‘s’
Not one student, but many students.

In this video, I’m going to talk about how
to make questions using subjective pronouns
So, let’s take a look at the board.
Remember, “I’m” is just a contraction for “I am”.
Now when we want to make a question,

we just have to make a simple 
change. It’s very easy.

All you have to do is put 
the ‘be’ verb in the front.
The ‘be’ verb comes in the front.
I also want you to listen to my intonation.
When I say it in a sentence, “I’m a student”.
Okay, then when I say it in a question.
Notice my intonation goes up for the question.

Okay, now there are two possible answers for
this question.

The answers you can say are:
“Yes, I am”.
We’re going to look at some more examples.
Please make sure you repeat after each example.
Let’s look at the first one.

Now, we’re going to talk about “he is”
and “she is” and how to use them in questions.
So let’s look at the sentence on the board.

Remember, “he’s” and “she’s” are
contractions for “he is” and “she is”.

So, when we make a question, we have to move
the ‘be’ verb to the front.
So we put ‘is’ in the front.
Just put the ‘be’ verb in the front.
Now I want you to listen to the intonation again.
In the question, again, the intonation goes up.

Now when you answer, they are several possible
answers you can give.

When you come to know, this is where it gets
a little tricky, but you can do it.
Okay, “isn’t” is a contraction for “is not”.
Okay, so you can use “she isn’t”, “he isn’t”.
Another answer you can give is “No, he’s not”.

You already know this is a contraction for
‘he is’ and ‘she is’.
And they’re both ok to use.

So, remember, we can give two 
different answers for ‘no’.

Alright, now we’re going to 
look at some more examples.
Please make sure you repeat after each example.
Now, we’re going to move on to ‘it is’.
And how to use that in a question.
So, let’s look at the board.
Remember, “it’s” is a contraction for “it is”.

When we make a question, remember, we have
to put the ‘be’ verb in the front.
The intonation goes up for the question.
Now, there are several answers you can give.
The first one is “Yes, it is”.
When you say “no”, you can give two answers.
Remember, “isn’t” is a contraction for “is not”.
We can also say “No, it’s not”.

So again, remember, we have these two answers
for ‘no’, but they’re both common and
they’re both ok to use when you say “no”.
We’re going to look at some more examples.

Please make sure you follow 
and repeat after each one.

Now, we’re going to move on to “you are”
and put that in a question.
On the board the sentence says.
Remember, “you’re” is a contraction for “you are”.

So we have to put that in 
the front of the question.
When we answer, it’s very simple.
We can say, “Yes, I am” or “No, I’m not”.
We’re going to look at some more examples.
Please follow and repeat after each one.

Now, let’s talk about “we are” and how
to use that in a question.
So the sentence here says, “We’re teachers”.
So the ‘be’ verb ‘are’ goes in the front.
When we answer, we can say several things.
Or we can say, “No, we’re not”.

And you know “We’re” is a 
contraction for “we are”.
We’re going to look at some more examples.
Now, we’re moving on to ‘they are’ in a question.
The sentence on the board says, “They’re friends”.

Remember, ‘They’re’ is a 
contraction for ‘they are’.

The ‘be’ verb ‘are’ goes in the front
of the question.
Now when we answer, we can say, “Yes, they are.”
Or, we can say, “No, they aren’t.”
The last thing we can say is “No, they’re not”.
These two answers for ‘no’ are both correct.
So you can say either one.
We’re going to look at some more examples now.

In this video, we’re going to talk about
‘this’ and ‘that’.
Now ‘this’ and ‘that’ are used to talk about nouns
that are close to us, near or far away.
So let’s look at the board.

Okay, we use ‘this’ to talk about 
one noun, “a flower”, that is close.

Okay, we use ‘that’ to talk 
about one noun that’s far away.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.
So we have to use the negative.
It’s close by, but it isn’t a flower.
It’s far away, so we say “that”.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.

Now we’re going to learn how to use
‘this’ and ‘that’ in a question.
So we know, “This is a flower”.
When we make a question, we have to switch.
So it becomes, “Is this a flower?”.
So the answer is, “Yes, it is”.

Okay, so we learned ‘this’ 
and ‘that’ in this video.

I hope you guys understand and 
I’ll see you in the next video.

In this video, we’re going to 
learn about possessive adjectives.

We use possessive adjectives to show that
something belongs to me,
or something belongs to someone else.
I own something or someone owns something.
So let’s take a look at the board.
Now last time we learned about subjective pronouns
And here are the possessive adjectives.
We use ‘my’ to show that something belongs to me.

This means that something belongs to one man
or one boy.

We use that to show something belongs to one
woman or one girl.

We use ‘its’ to show that something belongs
to an animal.

We use ‘your’ to show that 
something belongs to you.

‘Our’ means that something belongs to
me and you or me and somebody else.
Okay, or me and other people.

We use ‘their’ to show that something
belongs to many people.
Okay, not me, but many people.

Okay, now I want you to pay 
attention to three special words.

Now I want you to notice these words sound
like other words.

So you have to be careful 
not to get them confused.

‘Its’ sounds like the contraction for
‘it is’; ‘it’s’.
Okay, so, don’t get that confused.

‘Your’ sounds like the contraction for
‘you are’ ‘you’re’.
So make sure you use this one to show possession.

And the last word, ‘their’, it actually
sounds like two other words.

or the word t-h-e-r-e, the 
other word ‘there’. Okay.
So please don’t get those confused.
Now I know all of this sounds very hard,

but if you practice with me, 
I’m sure you’ll understand.
So let’s move on to the next part.
Now, here I have a marker.
So, I have to say, “This is my marker.”
Okay, let’s look at this boy.
So, I have to say, “This is his hat.”
And this girl has a dress.

Okay, in this picture there’s an animal;
a dog…and it has a ball.
I have to say, “This is its ball.”
Now, in this picture, we have two people.
Okay, and they both own this house.

Okay, now a little bit farther away, we have
three books.
And this boy and girl have the books here.
And because we have more than one,
So we say, “This is our country.”

Okay, let’s move on to the next 
part for some more practice.

We’re going to put possessive 
adjectives on these lines.
John is one man or boy.
Okay, for one man or boy, we say, “his”.
That’s more than one person. That’s two people.
Okay, let’s look at some more examples.
Okay, we have two people, Paul, and Sam.
So I have to say, “Can I use… your phone?”
And the next one. “_____ make-up looks good.”

Whose make-up? Well, usually

In this video, we’re going to talk about
the articles; ‘a’, ‘an’ and ‘the’.

Now this can be very confusing, so please
make sure you pay careful attention.
We use articles in front of nouns.

Okay, so remember that and 
let’s look at the board.

First, we use ‘a’ or ‘an’ when we’re
talking about any one thing.

For example, let’s say I 
say, “A banana is delicious.”
If I’m talking about a specific banana…
maybe I have a banana in my hand.
It’s specific, not any banana, this one.
I can’t say, “A banana is old.”
Then that means all bananas are old.
And that’s not true. Just this one.
So, I say, “The banana is old.”

We also use ‘a’ or ‘an’ when we’re
talking about something for the first time.
So, I have another example here.

I’m talking about this movie for the first
time, so I have to use “…a movie”.
But, if I want to talk about this movie again,

for the second time, or the 
third time or fourth, fifth…
I’m talking about this one. The specific.
I can’t say, “A movie was fun.”
That means all movies are fun.

when I’m talking about a noun 
where there’s only one and only.
For example, there’s only one sun.

Okay, when I look at the 
sky, there’s only one sun.
When there’s one and only, we say, “The sun.”
Let’s look at some more examples.
The first example says, “A lion is dangerous.”

I have to use ‘a’ because I’m 
talking about any one lion.
The next sentence says, “It’s a dog.”

I’m talking about this dog for the first time,
so I use ‘a’.

Now, I’m talking about this 
dog for the second time.
So, I say, “The dog is cute.”

Well, I used ‘an’ because we have ‘ant’,
which start with a vowel.

And I’m talking about this ant for the first
time.
Now, I’m talking about this ant again.

I have to say, “the moon” 
because there’s only one moon.
Let’s look at some more examples.
Okay, we have some more examples,

but this time I want you to think about
